headline: Rolo Pretzel Turtles
description: This Rolo pretzel recipe is easy to make with mini pretzels, chocolate caramel candies, and pecans. A deliciously chewy turtle candy treat!

video.description: These addictive candies use just three ingredients. Bake and gobble.
video.name: Pretzel Turtles

name: Rolo Pretzel Turtles

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.
Arrange pretzels in a single layer on the prepared cookie sheet. Place one caramel candy on top of each pretzel.
Bake in the preheated oven until caramels soften, about 4 minutes.
Remove from the oven and immediately press a pecan half into each warm caramel. Cool completely before serving.

review.reviewBody: First time I had these was at a family reunion. They are like Lay's potato chip...can't eat just one.
Way too sweet for a single bite. Won’t make again.
I don't use Rolos - I buy chocolate covered peanut butter balls in bulk at Winco. This is the easiest recipe for a snack I have ever made and everyone LOVES them.
I already posted a review and wanted to add that the correct temp and time is on the Rolo bag (the recipe is on the bag)
Easy peasy!! And everyone loves them. Better make a double or triple batch.
Toasted pecans for 5 minutes at 300 degrees...delicious!
I love making these candies every Christmas. They are so easy and tasty. And they usually are the first candies to go!
I made these to add to small gift bags for older neighbors. They love them and they are so easy to make. It’s just enough sweet and salty to enjoy!
My wife's friend made this for a holiday party. The the friend used Rolo's candy as a substitute for the caramels they were very good.
Making it for a party
Delicious and easy!
I really like this recipe, this time I sprinkle chopped pecans on top of the melted Rolo’s.
Very smooth and delicious! Great recipe to get kids involved in cooking!
This was so easy to do. I used the square waffle pretzels and rolos! Absolutely easy easy and yummy!
Love it!
Delish and easy. I used Kraft caramels, which I cut in half, instead of Rolos. Also I had walnuts so I used them instead of pecans.
So very easy and so delicious!

I’ve made these turtles for years. It’s a 2 bite candy that everyone loves. I wrap mine individually in a piece of wax paper. Put in a tin and you have a tasty gift. Getting ready to take the foil off the Rolo’s right now!
Awesome!
Yum! Super easy! I will be making again!!
Very easy and delicious! I am waiting to see how long they last in an air tight container. I used Rolo's because they're my favorites for cookies, candy and other recipe treats.
Awesome! Baked 3 minutes. Probably would be even better if I had toasted the pecans, but still were great!
So delicious! A new family favorite. I also toast the pecans to bring out their flavors beforehand. Circle pretzels. So fast and foolproof!
So easy and so amazingly good.
This is absolutely amazing 3rd year in a row making them. I had some sea salt on top and man you cannot beat it! Great to freeze and being out on occasion.
Amazing and yummy! So easy and fun to do. Make great gifts to friends , teachers etc. You can’t go wrong with it
Yummy
This recipe was extremely easy and delicious, but one problem we have with this recipe is that the chocolate made a huge mess while putting on the pecans.

I usually use the small square pretzels, Rolo candy and either a pecan, an M&M or just another pretzel on top. I don't bake mine for 4 minutes though. I usually just watch to see when the tops of the Rolos get shiny (about a couple of minutes) and take them out and top them. Otherwise they get too soft. These things are addictive. So easy and quick to make for a simple snack anytime.
How could anything be so simple and so good .
These are amazing!! I used gluten free pretzels. Soooooo easy. Hardest part is peeling the foil off of all the Rollos. They are easy to transport and store very well.
will definitely make again..
Can’t go wrong with this snack! It’s always a hit! I’ve made it for years...always use Rolo’s!!!
These are wonderful and simple to make - I use the star shaped mini pretzels so that they actually look like turtles with a head and four little feet sticking out. Super cute that way!
Yummy
Incredibly easy to make and taste great! Always popular.
It was received very well, and was easy to make. I did have some troubles with the pecans staying attached though.
Easy and everyone loved them!

Easy peasy and super delicious. We do not have round pretzels here. I used Snyder's of Hanover Snaps. They are a little square and worked perfectly. The most difficult part (other than not eating the entire batch) is unwrapping the Rolos.
These are a solid yummy treat! I made about 100 of them for my coworkers to give them at the holidays. Very simple and well-received! I used rolos & the square pretzels.

I just made a 10 batches of 16 turtles each and put them in the microwave on parchment paper on the flat glass microwave plate for 14 seconds instead of baking them in the oven. I cooled them by an an open window. It is very cold where I live, so they were set solid within ten minutes. I've packed 16 up in little Dollar Store decorated Xmas tins as gifts for my sisters, brother, four of my closest friends and two for me. They are so delicious when the chocolate and caramel is still a bit soft. Yummy in my tummy and I think this will become an annual thing for me.

wonderful Salty and chocolatelly
Used Great Value Creamy Caramel, got 36 turtles,
11/24/2013 for Thanksgiving

Made these guys in a double batch last night. They didn’t have the pretzel squares, so I had the mini round ones. I added some Kosher Salt at the top. Should have added more Salt, or buy Sea Salt. It was the perfect touch to an already tasty treat. My boyfriend said it tases like something you’d buy at the store.
Easy, loved by all in our family and friends' circles
It look so good and I want to eat the picture.
Easy. Make extra they go fast
So easy and fast to make!

Really nice! Mine didn't look as pretty because I had to cut up the caramel but taste really good and it's super easy! I used ghirardelli sea salt squares and cut them in 4's as this was all we could find in the local store
really good-next time I would do salted pecan/walnuts or peanuts instead. quick and easy
Perfect just the way it is

I didn't use the pecans, just another pretzel in it's place. My son and I could eat these all day long. We love the combo of milk chocolate, caramel and salt. Oh yes, we sprinkled them with sea salt while still warm.
i have a question i have a nut allergy so can i substitute the pecans for chocolate chips
2/24/19: I've made these numerous times. They're easy and SOOO delicious!
Oh I wish I hadn’t found this recipe, made them twice since Christmas! A little tip. Don’t remove from the baking sheet. Just refrigerate, then store in sealed container and eat chilled! Yum!
they taste soooooo... good!
Drizzle with white chocolte for a little xtra
Great tasting and easy Christmas treat. Two bags of Rolos, one bag of pretzels, and a bag of pecans. They made a very large sheet pan full, and I was able to share with everyone!
simple recipe. crowd pleaser!

My first batch was made with milk duds and I didn't toast the pecans. I give my first batch a two stars.... My friend made these and my first batch did not taste the same. So my second batch was made with Rolos , I toasted the pecans w/o butter, only 3 mins was enough to soften. 5 stars all the way.
Made these with the square pretzels. Did some with pecan half and some sandwiched with half dipped in melted milk chocolate. Found the Rolo's at 711!!
They are great snack..
These are so easy to make and so delicious! I only needed to bake mine for 3 minutes. I used Rolos with Utz wheels small round pretzels, and they worked perfectly together.
Super easy. Use Rolo candies. Why stop at 20? Fill the whole cookie sheet.

super easy and delish. i wanted Rollos, but store didnt have, instead went with the Dove Choco Carmels, which in my opinion are too thick and not as cute as Rollos for the waffle prezels. But my kids loved. I used a cinnamon almond on top.

I melt a little white chocolate and drizzle it over them right after the pecan goes on. I also used the round pretzels and butter toasted the pecans. 

My family loves these!!!
one of my favorites to make every christmas
Great recipe!

These are super easy to make and absolutely delicious!
Compliments my cookie trays perfectly!
Thank you for this recipe, it’s a keeper!
Incredibly to easiest and yummiest treats ever!!
The only change I make, is that after everything has cooled; I melt a few chunks of almond bark and quickly drizzle over the treats to make them appear more fancy.
I've made these for years. They always turn out just right and everyone loves them. Around the holidays I can't make them fast enough. I use the Snyder's Butter squares and Rolos. YUM!
Wonderful and so easy! A huge success at the bake sale!
Has anyone made these with Milkduds, since that's what they use in the video?

These are sinfully delicious & completely addictive ! They are the perfect mix of both sweet & salty flavors . Ive never come across anyone who doesn't absolutely devour and rave about them. They are also incredibly easy to make, (although if you have the choice, I recommend purchasing the Rolo's as individual candy bars (usually found at the check out lanes in grocery stores). They are not wrapped individually in this form, unlike in the larger bags of candy. Having to unwrap each Rolo from the large bags can be a bit more time consuming, especially if you are making multiple batches. On the flip side, buying the larger bags of candy, is less expensive, & definitely much more cost effective. I usually make at least 4-6 dozen ahead of time around the holidays and I keep them frozen until needed. I then pull out however many are needed, thaw them & then keep them refrigerated.
Super easy and delicious! Rolos are definitely the way to go. Thanks to previous reviewers for the suggestion.
So easy and so good!

Easy to make and delicious! Unwrapping chocolates was tedious, so definitely do it in front of the television as another reviewer recommended:) I used Rolos and regular pretzels. I just purchased dove caramels and the gridded square pretzels for my next batch!
So easy to make and it tasted great!!
These cookies are great! Instead of pecans I used Easter candies.

I doubled the recipe. My 4 year old made these and they were a hit. I used caramilk chocolate bar squares and topped half with smarties and half with candied pecans. they didn't make it through the day.

I read many of the reviews, and also watched the video. The "chocolate covered caramel candies" were obviously Milk Duds, so that is what I used. I chose to use the square pretzels, based on other reviewers suggestions. They were ok, but I think I would have liked them better using a higher grade candy. And because Milk Duds are somewhat small, the square pretzel flavor overpowered the chocolate/caramel and pecan. I did toast the pecans ahead of time, as I always do for all nuts in recipes, it makes all of the difference. If I made these again, I would use a higher grade candy and a preztel that is smaller.
cool,looks good and tastes good
I feel the better candy to use is rollo's mini's. They work great better than any other candy I have tried.
It was good. The recipe called for four minutes in the oven, but that was too much time. I would probably try two or three minutes next time.

Better than expected!!! I wasn't expecting much from this recipe, tried it & was pleasantly surprised Using small pretzels, letting Rolos candy melt 5 - 6 minutes in oven, gently placing roasted pecans spreading out the melted chocolates ended up with perfectly chocolate caramel goodness. After looking at photos, I feared it would become no more than a slightly melted & re-hardened candy on a pretzel. Not the case with care. Appearance & taste are Great! Thanks for the idea.
I think dove caramel chocolates are the way to go, and roasting the pecans first with butter and sea salt was really good.

I made these exactly as stated but was not impressed. I guess I had high expectations given the raving reviews on these. They weren't exactly bad, but not anything noteworthy. I think I'll look for a different recipe.

Doubled the recipe. Used the square shaped "Snap" pretzels. And Utz Caramel Chocolate Pieces (squares.) Had extra Pretzels so I decided to experiment using some plain Hershey Kisses, they did not melt as nice as the Caramel squares, so I would not recommend using those as a substitute.

Review that I found most helpful was from 
Marshmay – “MAKE IT SIMPLE!!!! Put your square pretzel on bottom, a Dove caramel chocolate next, and then the pecan half. Bake for 3 to 4 minutes at 300* Put it in the refrigerator immediately to cool for about 20 minutes. Don't make it harder than it really is people!!”
I put these together and added a caramel slice and used a buttered praline pecan - a nice extra sugar crunch!! Also, like many, I finished them with white chocolate couverture. Quite pleased!!

Candies tried: Dove Milk Chocolate Caramels -melts quickly (3 min), completely covers the pretzel, takes longer to cool, caramel is very soft, chocolate is light in color. Hershey's Milk Chocolate Caramels - melts quickly, takes longer to cool, caramel is medium soft, completely covers the pretzel, chocolate is darker without being dark. Hershey's Dark Chocolate Caramels - melts quickly, takes longer to cool, caramel is medium soft, completely covers the pretzel, chocolate is dark. Rolo - melts a little slower (4 min) but firms up quickly, caramel is medium soft, leaves some pretzel showing, chocolate is a dark milk chocolate color. Milk Duds - takes longer to melt (4min) but firms up quickly, 2 leave some pretzel showing, 3 covers completely, caramel is firm and sticky (just like the plain candy), chocolate is a dark milk.

Of all, my favorite ended up being the Rolos for ease of use, looks and taste. The caramel was soft and the chocolate was a good in-between dark and milk, and had the right balance between candy, pretzel, and nut. That said, they are all delicious. It appears you just can't go wrong with these.

This is a fast and easy recipe that rates 5 stars! Turtle bites is a good name because they taste like turtles. I used twisted small pretzels, Rollo candy, and whole premium pecans. Their good looks make the them seem like you worked harder than you did.

I won't melt the candy for 4 minutes again...too squishy/soft. I used the square pretzels, but I think the round ones are heartier and may make the soft rolo stand up better...I might try them again, but I don't think they'll be a gift this time around... also, I won't let the pretzels touch next time...
easy to make and fun to eat. This is a great treat to have around.

Update: the first time I made these, They were a disaster for me. I used square pretzels with rolos and balanced a half pecan on top of each one. 4 minutes later I had a melted gooey mess on my tray. They all stuck to the paper and could not be peeled off without taking pieces of paper with the pretzel. Unfortunately, they could not be saved. :( This time, I did exactly the same thing but removed the pretzels from the oven at exactly 3 minutes. I pressed the pecan on top and allowed them to cool. Perfect! So, watch the time.
quick, easy and EVERYONE loves them
These are delicious. I make for events when I don't have a lot of time, or when I don't want my oven running for too long.
Eddie loves it. Rolo candy on square pretzel.
These were a huge hit and so very easy. Worked just like the recipe said and I made them in like 7-10 minutes. Give it a few minutes to set up or put in fridge, ready to serve in less than 30 mins.
Not only are these ridiculously easy to make, but all the kids polish them off in no time! Even my husband loves them and he rarely eats any type of dessert.
